PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

A NOTE OF EXPLANATION TO THE PERSON COMPLETING THIS QUESTIONNAIRE

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experience or a similar one. Some of the questions here will not apply to your experiences while others may be applicable. If there is not sufficient space to answer all the questions, please give details, or describe particular events, if they help to answer the questions.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1924, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled "Pioneer Diet: What Did Western Canadian Pioneers Eat?" is still being circulated. If you have not already answered this, and would be willing to do so, please put a check mark here ( ).

Saskatchewan Archives questionnaires on other subjects will be prepared at a later date. Some of these are listed below. Please mark the ones you would be willing to answer.

[ ] All questionnaires
[ ] Pioneer health conditions
[ ] Pioneer social life, sports and recreation
[ ] Pioneer housing
[ ] Pioneer education and churchwork
[ ] Pioneer farming experience

Preservation of Questionnaires

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives Board's Office at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent record of our Province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Sask.,

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

A note of explanation to the person completing this questionnaire:

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experiences or views.

Some of the questions here will not apply to your experiences; others may be impossible for you to answer, so don't worry about leaving blank answers. The greatest help to us will be if you can give details, or describe particular events, in as many brief answers as possible.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1924, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires:

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled "Western Canadian Pioneer Family Life," is still being circulated. If you have not already answered this, and would be willing to do so, please put a check mark here ( ).
